 A couple of his easily proven and debunked frauds:
 
 He discusses the Militia act of 1792. Here is how he quotes the act:
 
 Further, "every citizen so enrolled, shall...be constantly provided with a good musket or firelock, a sufficient bayonet and belt, two spare flints," and other accoutrements. Congress took upon itself the responsibility of providing those guns, and specified that within five years all muskets "shall be of bores sufficient for balls of the eighteenth part of a pound."
 
 He points out that it says "be constantly provided" in an effort to prove that individual arms were not required, the government provided them all. The only problem with this is that the Militia act of 1792 REALLY says:
 
 "That every citizen so enrolled and notified, shall within six months thereafter, provide himself with  a good musket or firelock, a sufficient bayonet and belt, two spare flints, and a knapsack, a pouch with a box therein to contain not less than twenty-four cartridges, suited to the bore

 This is just stupid. He was vindicated both by his employer as well as by most of his piers (there are always the anti-gunners out there, such as finkleman, who refuse to quit beating a horse even after it is long dead). In light of the evidence he ended up producing, the loss of data was found to be not only plausable, but probable. He has since repeated the study, and updated his report using the new figures. 
 
 For all reasonable purposes, he has been vindicated. Even when the GG's started questioning that figure, his employer was not prepared to undertake an investigation. they called it (and rightly so) nitpicking and not worthy of consideration. it was not until the whole thing got blown entirely out of proportion by the GG's trying to spread doubt about the report that an investigation ensued, and even then it was at Lotts request.
 
 Realistically, what you have here is not a question of dishonesty on the part of Lott, but on the part of the anti-gunners who are trying to use a possible error in one sentence of the report to cast doubt over the entire thing. Lott set out to make this report bullet proof. His methodology is unquestionable, his data sets are publicly available and meticulously compiled, his conclusions are sound.
 
 Lacking the controversy of that single figure, the report stands as THE definitive work on the subject. Lacking that single sentence, the anti-gunners are relegated to a pthetic "Well, there could have been other factors like drug use" defense. Thre could have been other factors such as which direction the wind was blowing as well. This is why he used data sets from so many counties. By using a large enough sample, you effectively factor out these other things.
 
 the reality of ths controversy is that Lott has prepared a bulletproof report that difinitively shows that a good deal of the GG's argument is WRONG. There is no wiggle room, it is just WRONG.
